Best monster types for exploration?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Expeditions: General Questions: Best monster types for exploration?
By have clue -- will travel on Monday, June 19, 2000 - 07:09 am:

I'm still fairly new to expeditions in MR2(having focused mostly on whomping the hell out of opponents), and am having problems finding anything. Naturally, this is because most of my monsters are Pow-based and thus couldn't find their own butts in a fogbank Int-wise. Sending a Beaclon to Torles let me find lots of items through sheer persistence alone, but they were all Disc Chips and Lump of Ice and such (I WANT that glue, dammit).

However, I'm a little unnerved that obstacles seem to regenerate from year to year. In MR1, it was pretty straightforward -- take a high-Pow monster through and stomp all the obstacles into the ground, then take a high-Int monster next year and get rich. This time, I'd seem to need a monster high in Pow (to clear obstacles) AND Int (to find anything... AND Lif (so it has enough energy to do anything before having to turn back). There aren't too many that can do average-to-well in all three of those.

What monster types have people had success with? I haven't unlocked many of the hidden types yet (part of the reason I'm going on expeditions in the first place) -- I've gotten Mock, Ghost and Beaclon apart from the FIMBA Four and Golem/Baku.

By torey_luvullo on Monday, June 19, 2000 - 07:33 am:

i had my best success with int based monsters - 700+ int seems to get good results. most obstacles can be moved by a monster with 200+ pow.
lif goes in 70 point increments - 210-279 gets you 210 life points on expedition; 280-349 gets you 280, etc.

my best finders were a suezo specifically trained for the task, and a pure pixie who had 150 pow along with 350 lif.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Monday, June 19, 2000 - 09:42 pm:

Most people I've heard like to root (pardon the pun) for the Mock as best errantry critter. Myself, I found most of my thnigs with a Stripe Shell (including hte big footprint and the joker mask).

My biggest 'find' critter after him has been my Jill, and I think dragons would work extremely well for the same reason: tons of power, tons of intelligence, and good life to fall back on. Phoenix are a good monster for it as well, if you've got the fearther unlocked.

If you haven't got any of the monsters unlocked, I suggest, as Torey said, a suezo. They get good life gains to help with their intelligence. Pixies need the power (at least 300 is good) to keep up.

As a note: I suggest that using Beaclon is a relatively bad idea, just because a lot of them are dumb as bricks. Persistance'll help, but to find a lot of the 'good' stuff, you'll want the intelligence for better attacks.

Oh, and as a note: before you get the glue, you have to have built the quack doll at least once. Just in case you haven't gotten that done, yet.

By have clue -- will travel on Tuesday, June 20, 2000 - 07:49 am:

Well, yes, the Beaclon was an idiot. However, he was the only monster I had with >300 life, and so he lasted long enough on expeditions to find _something_. Just not much.

I got Gonzalez from a Sueki Suezo sacrifice, took one look at his stats and said ACK! Mixing him with a well-trained Ape produced a pure Mock with decent numbers that just found me the Glue -- he's pretty hopeless for combat (speed and skill go up at pitiful rates), but seems reasonably good for exploration right now (age 2, 680 Int, 200 Pow, 280 Lif).

Next up: Fire Feather. I hope.

By PezCat on Tuesday, June 20, 2000 - 03:17 pm:

If you're raising it purely for expeditions, I'd suggest Dragon, myself. But that's me. Dragon
POW and INT goes up real quick, and LIF is decent, so you'll have the time. I had one Dragon
(actally, I think he was the Dodongo [Dragon/Bajarl] that I trained) that cleaned out 5
buildings and had time to spare when I brought him back in from the Jungle.

Mocks aren't bad if you can get their life up, but I just detest those friggin' trees...

PezCat

By Nate Railsback on Friday, June 23, 2000 - 03:10 pm:

Actually, Beaclons seem to be fairly lucky at finding items, from what I've gathered. If Intelligence is a problem, just get it a Henger or Tiger sub-type. Worms, Zuums, and Mocks also seem to be natural-born hunters. Finally, I once saw someone suggest a Gali/Worm, since the Gali main-type would give it high Power, Intelligence, and Skill, and the Worm sub-type would give it extra Life and lifespan. Seemed to be a pretty good suggestion to me.

By torey_luvullo on Monday, August 14, 2000 - 04:57 am:

i like the pixies too, james. nope, no secrets, just a lot of pixies raised and combined. for a story about lisl, the 350 lif pixie, and how she became the 'mother' of another pixie who ended up with 321 lif, read the thread called "time out for super pixie" in the july 2000 topics in the cafe. my method is basic. i max out the pixie in her three favorite categories, int, ski and spd, then i use excess int on perpetual swim drills for the rest of her life.

btw, this is by no means the highest accomplishment of pixie stats, even on this board. 3 people off the top of my head i remember as having pixies with higher lif - sct, eagle fierce and pixiemaster all had pixies with better lif than either iris or lisl. [probably more that i dont remember too]. maybe they will add to this thread and give a little more help in that noblest of endeavors: "the raising of a pixie!"

By Petit-Trot on Tuesday, August 15, 2000 - 07:14 am:

My expedition monster is a tiger/tiger. It has gotten me everything needed to unlock monsters and is still supplying me with Golden Peaches.

By Phoenix Masta on Wednesday, August 16, 2000 - 01:53 pm:

Phoenix for me since I always max out Int. and get ski.(ok skill has nothing to do with expeditions right?) and lif. Power on my phoenixes is usually about 300, quite enough with the high lif. be seein' ya

By torey luvullo on Wednesday, August 16, 2000 - 06:15 pm:

im not sure its been proven one way or the other the effect of skill on expeditions, p.m. - ive sure seen plenty of posts by people i respect saying it seems to them that skill has something to do.

i cant prove it one way or another, because its been so long since i sent a monster on expedition who had high int and low ski. lately, all my peachfinders have been high in both.
